ygData.subject: Re: [eqenchanters] RE: Digest Number 297
ygData.msgSnippet: doh, your right.... ... From: Treadway, Donald  To:  Sent: Monday, June 12, 2000 9:54 AM Subject: RE:
ygData.messageBody:
doh, your right....

----- Original Message -----
From: Treadway, Donald <dtreadway@...>
To: <eqenchanters@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, June 12, 2000 9:54 AM
Subject: RE: [eqenchanters] RE: Digest Number 297


> LOL, I think you mean the SMR, shiny metallic robe, that come from lower
> Guk.
> The FBR, flowing black robe, comes from Najeena I believe...fine for 20's.
>
> > ----------
> > From: Daniel Devorkin[SMTP:devo@...]
> > Reply To: eqenchanters@egroups.com
> > Sent: Monday, June 12, 2000 10:52 AM
> > To: eqenchanters@egroups.com
> > Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] RE: Digest Number 297
> >
> > i agree with all that you said cept for the FBR hehe. that drops off the
> > AM
> > in LGUK.....even with a full group of upper 20's they will all die.
> > you at least need to be level 35-40 to go in there and get that.
> >
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: "Andrew Collins" <ACollins@...>
> > To: <eqenchanters@egroups.com>
> > Sent: Monday, June 12, 2000 9:37 AM
> > Subject: [eqenchanters] RE: Digest Number 297
> >
> >
> > > Basically charisma is more important than anything for an enchanter.
> > > Things you can get around your level are the bracelets of woven grass,
> > > thaumaturgist/gossimer robe, you should *almost* be able to quest for
> > the
> > > incandescent gloves, hardest part would be the shadowmen who are
around
> > > level 25. Once you hit upper 20s (28, 29) you can get gatorscale
> > sleeves.
> > > By mid 20s you can get drakescale leggings, and mid 20s will also get
> > you
> > a
> > > pair of wolf fur slipper, and a runed circlet. high 20s can get you a
> > > lizardscale cape, and quite possibly an fbr.
> > >
> > > All of these level suggestions are based on *full* groups.
> > >
> > > Also, as a side note, I havent meleed since level 32. Should have
> > stopped
> > > meleeing before that. The mana you recover while you would otherwise
be
> > > doing paltry damage, is worth it.
> > >
> > > Maelael
> > > 53rd Enchanter
> > > Saryrn
> > >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: eqenchanters@egroups.com [mailto:eqenchanters@egroups.com]
> > > Sent: Sunday, June 11, 2000 5:44 AM
> > > To: eqenchanters@egroups.com
> > > Subject: Digest Number 297

I
> > solo
> > > I use a Obsidian shard, not the best weapon, but that 30pt proc helps.
> > > Always with a Dragoon Dirk in the missile slot.

> > > Message: 1
> > > Date: Fri, 9 Jun 2000 13:20:09 -0600
> > > From: "Melinda" <warnock@...>
> > > Subject: Decking out my Enchanter
> > >
> > > Ive been searching everlore and etc to see what was the best robe and
> > weapon
> > > for my enchanter. This is basically an opinion taking email.
> > >
> > > Im lvl 21, hi elf ench.. Currently Im wearing the gold robe from
erudin
> > and
> > > a nice lvl 50 mage gave me a staff of writhing.
> > >
> > > Im also interested in any opinions on other good items for enchanters.
> > >
> > > Please let me know,
> > >
> > > Thanks
> > > Calistaah
> > > 21st Season
> > > Veeshan Svr
> > >
> > >

> > > Message: 2

> > > From: "Farr, Robert" <robert.farr@...>
> > > Subject: RE: Decking out my Enchanter
> > >
> > > At your level you should be able to afford a Flowing Black Robe.
> > >
> > > Also, the staff of writhing is about the opposite of what you need.
> > Charisma
> > > is the LAST thing you need to have reduced by items.
> > >
> > > > -----Original Message-----
> > > > From: Melinda [SMTP:warnock@...]

> > > Message: 3
> > > Date: Fri, 9 Jun 2000 12:41:54 -0700 (PDT)
> > > From: Mark Rafn <dagon@...>
> > > Subject: Re: Decking out my Enchanter
> > >
> > > On Fri, 9 Jun 2000, Melinda wrote:
> > >
> > > > Im lvl 21, hi elf ench.. Currently Im wearing the gold robe from
> > > > erudin and a nice lvl 50 mage gave me a staff of writhing.
> > >
> > > Staff of writhing is ONLY good if you're killing very light greens
(like
> > > skeletons too dumb to leave you alone). It's got good dmg/delay, and
> > the
> > > proc (at L29) is nice, but -9 CHA is very painful.
> > >
> > > If you have some L25+ friends to group with, you can probably get a
rod
> > of
> > > insidious glamor (+12 CHA) or incandescent wand (procs color shift)
from
> > > Sultin in Solusek Ro.
> > >
> > > Of course, for many enhanter situations, the 2-stein plan (crude and
> > > moggok) is better than an actual weapon.
> > > --
> > > Mark Rafn dagon@... <http://www.dagon.net/>
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
________________________________________________________________________
> > >
________________________________________________________________________
> > >
> > > Message: 4
> > > Date: Fri, 9 Jun 2000 13:34:24 -0700
> > > From: Shawn Alley <shawna@...>
> > > Subject: RE: Decking out my Enchanter
> > >
> > > I agree. I use stein of mogok and crude stein for selling or when my
> > charm
> > > based attacks are important. At other times I use the insidious rod
> > with
> > a
> > > crude stein. I was able to get the rod myself with the hardest part
> > coming
> > > from upper guk (priest I think). I patiently waited for a chance to
> > loot
> > > the golden rod.
> > >
> > > you'll want to go for +cha and +int items with +cha being more
important
> > I
> > > think; but it really depends on the situation. I have a savants cap,
> > green
> > > silken drape, and incandescent gloves (which are a very easy quest).
> > Next
> > > I'd like to quest for the incandescent mask but the rune in mistmoore
> > will
> > > be a bit of a pain I think.
> > >
> > > I would buy gold or plat int or cha jewelry when you can collect the
> > cash.
> > >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Mark Rafn [mailto:dagon@...]
> > > Sent: Friday, June 09, 2000 12:42 PM
> > > To: eqenchanters@egroups.com

(like

> > > proc (at L29) is nice, but -9 CHA is very painful.
> > >
> > > If you have some L25+ friends to group with, you can probably get a
rod
> > of
> > > insidious glamor (+12 CHA) or incandescent wand (procs color shift)
from
> > > Sultin in Solusek Ro.
> > >
> > > Of course, for many enhanter situations, the 2-stein plan (crude and
